event.name: ENCOUNTER_SHELL
event.text: Shells usually like to take refuge in the nebulas, but it seems one has wandered too far into a clearing. They seem to think you must be hunting them, because they immediately attack!

textList.name: CLAN_FIGHT
textList.text: You've discovered a Slug Clansman resting outside of the nebula. However, as soon as they spot you they abandon their rest and attack immediately.
You notice several Slug Clansmen planning out their attack on a Shell colony when they notice you eavesdropping, prompting them to retaliate!

event.name: SHELL_CLAN_CHOICE
event.text: A Shell and a Slug Clansmen ship have entered a dogfight at this beacon. It seems the only way to get past is to fight one of them.

You attack the Shell ship head on. The Clan ship breaks away. Apparently, their dedication to the hunt does not go so far as to putting themselves in debt of a Federation ship, and so they jump away to leave you alone with the Shells.
You attack the Slug Clansmen head on. The Shells don't seem to want to stick around to see the outcome, and jump away.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_FOSSILS
event.text: Nearby drifts a Shell biologist, close to a large unpopulated planet. You receive a hail from the ship. "Long ago, we thhhink thhhis planet might have been habitable! Even more so, it could even hold thhhe fossils to thhe missing link between thhhe Shell and Slug races! Isn't thhhat cool?"

"Oh, it is so amazing to meet someone else who finds thhhhis interesting! Oohh, ohh, I know! I have a job for you, if you're interested. There's a couple fossil samples on thhhat planet that I want to collect, but thhhe atmosphere is too thhin for us to survive long. Do you thhhhink you could go get thhhem for us? Retrieving thhhem shouldn't be hard, thhhhere should be an abandoned dig site nearby."

You pilot down to the surface of the planet, where you spot a Smuggler ship collecting the fossils for themselves. "Hey, I wonder how much we could sell these funky rocks on the market fo- ah crap, it's a Fed! Run!"
"Thhhat's ok. Thhhanks for listening to my rambling anyways!"
You don't have time to take a biology lesson.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_TOXINTEST
event.text: Nearby appears to be a Shell science laboratory. They hail you. "Oh, good a visitor! We haven't seen many people recently, which is rathhhher unfortunate. With so many new... Rebels coming by we've noticed you outsiders react rathhher strangely to our toxins. We would like to test the effects on any aliens you might have... we understand thhhe risk and will pay accordingly."
"We uh... appreciate thhhe gesture, but we really don't need to test on our own species..."

choice.text: (Anaerobic Crew) Send over your Anaerobic crew.

event.text: "How interesting! While the toxin certainly still has an effect, smaller doses don't seem to cause as much harm. I wish I could test larger concentrations, but thhhat would be almost certainly fatal. Regardless, thhhank you for your help!"
"It is okay, I'm sure a Federation ship such as yours has more important thhhings to do anyways."
"As to be expected. We've seen these results quite often on Rebel ships. Quite harmful I'd say!" They send back your crew, who looks rather sick but healthy enough to keep working.
"Oh... Oh dear. That was quite fast... I have bad news I'm afraid, it seems your crew did not react well... at all. I don't believe thhhere is anythhhhing we can do to save thhhem."
There is nothing you can do to save your crew. The Shells deeply apologize and offer to greatly increase their payment.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, you happen to have a Clone Bay to revive your crew, but the Shells don't have to know that...

event.text: You hurry your crew to the medbay to heal them. The Shells still apologize and offer to increase the payment.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_CIVILIAN
event.text: Shell civilians aren't usually ones for direct combat... but with the bulk of the Military District on strike, a few have felt the need to take it into their own hands to protect the sector. Apparently, you're a threat, because the nearby Shell ship attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_MANAGEMENT
event.text: A Shell management vessel is performing construction on a nearby security checkpoint. Your sudden appearance has concerned them, and without any other ships to protect the checkpoint, they jump the gun and attack!

textList.name: NEBULA_SHELL_MILITARY_FIGHT
textList.text: The Shell Military district is in shambles, and their workforce on strike. Still, those most loyal to the Geniocracy remain behind to protect their people. Protect them from who? You, apparently.

"Military vessels are not allowed thhhis close to civilian districts! Federation or not, you will leave at once!" You try to explain your FTL drive isn't charged yet, but the Shells won't listen and get agitated, then attack!

"Unauthorized non-Shell personnel have been identified on your vessel. Under orders of Director and Standing-President Nerva, Federation officials are not allowed in Geniocracy territory. You will be removed."
A Shell militant vessel has locked onto your vessel. You wonder if they're going to stop and scan you, but they instantly open fire! So much for Shell space being friendly!

textList.name: NEBULA_CLAN_SHELL_FIGHT
textList.text: It appears you've run into one of the dangerous members of the Exotic Hunter's Guild. These Slug hunters tend to hunt Shells for their armor, but they aren't above hunting other ships as well!
"Hope you undersssstand it's nothin' persssonal kid, but your head would look mighty fine on my trophy wall!" A Slug clansman and his ship approach, weapons ready.
From out of the nebula comes a Slug hunter, barring their weapons straight at you!
You start to get the sinking feeling that you're being followed. You spin the ship around to face your pursuer, to see a Slug Clansman heading straight for you!
"Ah, look at that one. Sssssurely he'sss got sssomething worth bringing back to the Guild!" A nearby Slug vessel moves in to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_SLUG
event.text: Usually, standard Slug ships like to avoid Shell sectors, not wanting to start a feud with their cousin species. However, one outlier ship appears to have crossed paths with you, and now it seems they're looking to fight!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_AUTO
event.text: The Rebels aren't big fans of the Shells, but they're usually too afraid of their toxins to attack them in person. Instead, they prefer to send Auto-ships to do their dirty work. Unfortunately, one of these Auto-ships recognizes you and attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_SMUGGLER
event.text: It appears a Smuggler ship is trying to sneak their way through this nebula! They notice you watching them and attack, not wanting you to rat out their location!

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_SUZERAIN
event.text: Perhaps the last ship you expected to see in these nebulas were a Suzerain. Even less so, one who hails you almost immediately after jumping in.

"Captain, captain. These Shells, they very interesting, yes? I looking to capture one and use it for personal claw sharpener, but keep sawing in half!" The Mantis chuckles. "Do happen have Shell I can use?"

choice.text: Apologize, decline, and get the hell out of here.
Apologize, decline, and get the hell out of here.

event.text: "Tsk tsk, I know you having Shell on there! I cannot just let you get away with my prize!"
You power up the weapons and engage the Suzerains.

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Give the Suzerain your Shell crew.

event.text: You pass over your Shell to the Suzerain.

removeCrew.text: Though your Shell will likely be dead soon, it's probably best you don't clone them after this.

event.text: "Ah, thanking you! This one doing well, yes! Here is pay. Take warrior, not enough room for him now."

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Give the Suzerain your Shell Scientist.

event.text: You pass over your Shell to the Suzerain.

removeCrew.text: Though your Shell will likely be dead soon, it's probably best you don't clone them after this.

event.text: "Ah, thanking you! This one doing well, yes! Here is pay. Take warrior, not enough room for him now."

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Give the Suzerain your Shell Mechanic.

event.text: You pass over your Shell to the Suzerain.

removeCrew.text: Though your Shell will likely be dead soon, it's probably best you don't clone them after this.

event.text: "Ah, thanking you! This one doing well, yes! Here is pay. Take warrior, not enough room for him now."

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Give the Suzerain your Shell Guardian.

event.text: You pass over your Shell to the Suzerain.

removeCrew.text: Though your Shell will likely be dead soon, it's probably best you don't clone them after this.

event.text: "Ah, thanking you! This one doing well, yes! Here is pay. Take warrior, not enough room for him now."

choice.text: (Radiant Crew) Give the Suzerain your Radiant crew and let them be poisoned.

event.text: You send over your Radiant to the Suzerain. Not realizing it's a trap, they offer you a large reward.

Not long after, you notice radio silence from the Suzerain ship. You receive a hail from your Radiant, who you come pick up again. You take a brief glance into the ship and see all of the Mantis twitching on the ground, their brains having been reduced to mush.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_COALITION_RECRUITER
event.text: You notice a familiar shade of blue in this nebula. You quickly hide after realizing it's the Coalition! You catch radio chatter between them and a Shell ship, trying to recruit the Shells to their side.

choice.text: Interject and try to recruit the Shells yourself!

event.text: "Wha-" You cut off the Coalition and interrupt the conversation, preaching about the Federation. The irate Coalition captain continues his monologue, but the Shells don't seem to know who to listen to.

choice.text: Try to sway over the Shells with promises of a friendly alliance.

event.text: You make promises of a long-lasting alliance, open borders, and of course free cookies. The offer, especially the last part, seems to win over the Shells, much to the displeasure of the Coalition ship. Seeing that they've failed their mission, they decide to attack your ship!

choice.text: Try to sway over the Shells with promises of safety.

event.text: You promise safety to the Shells, but they could care less. Already confident in their defense, they opt to listen to the Coalition ship instead, who turns out to be very convincing. Now that they've won over the Shells, the ship attacks you next!

choice.text: Try to sway over the Shells with threats.

event.text: You threaten the Shells, but it does little more then agitate them. They opt to listen to the Coalition ship instead, who turns out to be very convincing. Now that they've won over the Shells, the ship attacks you next!

The Shells seem to believe the word of their friend. Confident in the Federation, one of them even offer to join your crew, much to the displeasure of the Coalition ship. Seeing that they've failed their mission, they decide to attack your ship!

choice.text: Step in and attack the Coalition ship.

event.text: You slip out of your hiding spot and attack the Coalition vessel. The Shell ship quickly jumps away.
If the Shells want to join the Coalition, so be it. Hopefully, they realize what a mess they're getting into though...

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_CLAN_LODGE
event.text: It appears the Exotic Hunters Guild has established a hunting lodge near this beacon. Quite a bold move doing it within Shell space, but the Clansmen were never known for respecting territorial boundaries.
You'll be doing everyone a favor by getting rid of these guys. You ready the weapons and move in for the kill.
The lodge, seeing one of their members aboard your ship, agrees and transfers over some supplies.
It won't be long until one of the Shells notices this place and puts a stop to their operation. You have more important things to do than bother it.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_HIDING
event.text: You notice a Shell vessel, heavily damaged but still partially operational drifting nearby. Suddenly, the computer registered an unwanted teleporter signal!

A Shell materializes on the ship, and quickly rolls away into a far corner. Not long after, a Slug Clansman comes out from the nebula, firing a shot into the Shell ship, destroying it. It's not hard to piece two and two together here.

choice.text: Hand over the Shell to the Clansmen.

event.text: You wait and hope for the Slugs to pass by. Fortunately, they don't seem to think anything of your ship and ignore you. The Shell thanks you for keeping their secret and offers to work alongside your crew.

You hope the Slugs won't notice, but unfortunately it seems their telepathic abilities have detected the Shell hiding aboard your ship. Seeing you as their next target, they attack almost immediately! You rush to defensive positions, followed by your new Shell friend.

You contact the Slugs, informing them one of the Shells escaped to your ship. They offer payment for them in return for the Shell. However, while you attempt to capture the creature it explodes, killing one of your crew on impact. It only takes a few shots to kill the creature afterwards, and luckily the Shell's exterior is still whole enough that the Slugs are willing to pay for it.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately the Clone Bay has already begun the process of cloning your crew.

event.text: Your crew grab onto the Shell, hauling them up off the ground and helplessly into the air. You contact the Slugs and inform them that the Shell is aboard your ship. Pleased with your help, they take the Shell back with them and transfer over some scrap.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_ZOLTAN_TOXIN
event.text: You're hailed by a Zoltan science vessel. "You are a Federation vessel, correct? We request that you do us a service - for pay of course - by hunting down and capturing a Shell vessel. We wish to reverse engineer their toxins to develop a non-fatal paralysing chemical for peaceful conflict resolution."
"It is imperative that you do not destroy the vessel so that we may harvest the gas." The Zoltans direct you to a nearby Shell ship.
"Do not think that we will forget your unwillingness to help your allies." The Zoltans say no more.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_ADBUCTION
event.text: You spot a civilian ship nearby under attack by a Shell Abductor!

You're surprised to see the Shells actually respond to your hails. "Hello. Thhhis might look bad, but we promise not to harm thhhhese civilians. We only want to run a couple tests on thhhhhem, nothing more. It's for science!"

choice.text: Demand they leave the civilians alone.
Explain the situation to the civilians.

event.text: You don't give the Shells any chances and attack immediately.
You aren't sure why the Shells are attacking, but it's best not for you to get involved.

It appears the civilians did not survive the Shells' attempts at abduction. Whether they died from the fight or earlier from the deadly toxins, it's too late now. You scrap some of the less damaged parts of their ship.
It appears most of the civilians did not make it out of the conflict alive. The last survivor requests to work aboard your ship.
The Shells aren't particularly interested in listening to you. Instead, they have decided to try and capture your crew instead!
The Shells don't seem to want to mess with you. They listen to your demands and pull away from the civilians. The civilian ship thanks you for saving them.
After you explain the Shells don't intend to hurt the civilians, you manage to work out a compromise between the two. The Shells pay you for helping reach a peaceful resolution.
Your attempts at explaining only make the civilians even more afraid. They attempt to flee, and the Shells accuse you of assisting! The ship attacks.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_NEUROTOXINLAB
event.text: Through the clouds of this nebula you spot a Rebel science station. It's strange to see one of these in Shell space, but surely there's a good reason.
Strangely, no Rebel ships interrupt you as you approach. Even stranger, the station appears to be empty of all life-signs except for one.

Surely, only one Rebel could cause no harm to you. You send over your crew. Inside, they find a large laboratory scattered with the corpses of scientists, though none have any visible wounds. The room smells faintly strange.

Your crew continue through the station, searching for the life-sign you had detected earlier. They find an unshaven, dishevelled engineer rocking back and forth, drooling and hugging a large cube. Your crew manage to calm him down long enough for him to explain the situation. It appears the engineers aboard were tasked with researching the neurotoxin released by the Shells and weaponize it, when one of their Auto-ships turned hostile. Using the toxin, it killed off all of the other scientists. The engineer warns you that now that you've boarded the station, the AI must know you're here too!
Your crew, followed by the psychotic engineer, hurry back to the ship. As they do, a large Auto-ship detaches from the station and chases you!

choice.text: This is strange. Pull out your crew.

event.text: You call the crew back to the ship, just in case.
You put some distance between yourself and the Rebel station, for good measure.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_SHELL_CHOICE
event.text: You spot a Shell ship approaching a small Slug transport. You aren't sure what the Slugs did to deserve this, but the Slugs are in trouble.

Almost immediately after moving to help the Slugs they jump away, sending one last message to your ship's computer. "Psych!" The Shell ship is confused but assumes you have something to do with it and attacks!
You ignore the Slug ship and move past.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_SHELL_SUFFOCATING
event.text: A nearby Shell ship appears to be the source of the distress beacon. Their life support has broken, and they're suffocating rapidly!

choice.text: Board and try to save the Shells!

event.text: You dock with the Shell ship, but it seems they aren't happy to see you. They mistake you for pirates and attack, though they won't last long without oxygen...

choice.text: (Upg. Oxygen) Dock and refill their O2.

event.text: You dock with the Shell ship and slowly refill their oxygen. It appears it's just enough to keep their levels stable long enough for the last survivor to escape. Without any crew or ship left, they offer to join yours.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Send over the Orchid to refill their oxygen.

event.text: You dock with the Shell ship and slowly refill their oxygen. It appears your Orchid is just enough to keep their levels stable long enough for the last survivor to escape. Without any crew or ship left, they offer to join yours.
Unfortunately, docking with their ship is likely too hazardous, considering Shell ships contain neurotoxin gases. It's best for you to not get involved.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_STORM
event.text: It appears a Shell ship is waiting inside this Ion storm. For what reasons they find you hostile you aren't sure, but it appears you can't get out of this fight so easily.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELLHOME_LAB
event.text: You receive a hail from a Federation vessel hiding in the nebula. "Oh, good, you must be the backup we called for! We were transporting troops to the Last Stand when we were forced to detour through this sector. We thought we would be fine until a Shell Abductor came from nowhere and abducted our crew! We suspect they're being held at this beacon in a nearby laboratory, but we don't have enough firepower to rescue them on our own."

choice.text: Agree to help and inspect the station.

event.text: The station is unlike any other station you've ever seen. Massive and painted in the colors of an Elite, this must be an important location.

choice.text: Hail them and negotiate peacefully. No need to murder these scientists.

event.text: "Oh, a Federation vessel. Welcome to thhhis beacon! What can I do for you?" You explain the situation, and the Shell seems to contemplate for a moment. "Oh, I see. My apologies, it has always been Shell custom to study creatures who enter our space. We bring no harm to them of course, we simply bring them aboard, run a quick few painless tests, and send them on our way. We meant no harm! Do not worry, I'll have them all released immediately. We want no trouble."

While the Shells are releasing the Federation crew, you notice another jump signature has been detected. Suddenly, a large stealth vessel jumps into the beacon. You catch a message sent from the ship to the Shells. "This is DA-SR 12, responding to the Federation distress beacon. You are in possession of Class-B Federation personnel. We will be docking with you shortly, you will surrender and be taken aboard for arrest or we will use force."

choice.text: The Shells don't deserve this! Protect them and attack the Stealth ship.

event.text: You maneuver the ship in-between the Stealth Cruiser and the Shells. "You are protecting criminals? We will have no choice but to use force then!"

choice.text: Crap, we can't get involved in this. Leave.
Attack the station in hopes you can save the Soldiers.

event.text: You arm the weapons and attack the Shell Laboratory. If you want to save the Soldiers, you'll have to clean this place of crew without destroying the hull.

choice.text: This is more than we expected, leave.
Explain that you aren't the backup and leave.

event.text: You apologize to the Federation ship and explain you're on a more important mission. Hopefully, the real backup will arrive soon to help them.

event.name: SHELLHOME_LAB_RESCUE_LAB
event.text: "You saved us! Thhhat was a Federation ship thhhough... You would betray your own people to save us? I'm not sure how to thhhink about thhhat. But I don't have time to anyways. Please, I hope you will allow me to come with you now that I cannot stay here. I will of course still free these men and send them back to their ship first."

destroyed.text: The laboratory explodes, undoubtedly killing all of the crew, including the Federation personnel, inside. You hope the Federation doesn't hear about this blunder...

deadCrew.text: You've killed all of the scientists aboard the station. You scrap the exterior of the hull.

event.text: You board the station and free all of the Federation personnel. They thank you briefly before rushing back to their ship, which has docked with the station to retrieve them. The Federation ship thanks you and pays you for your help.

You take a quick look around the station before you leave and find a strange device in one of the laboratories. It appears to be made to emit the neurotoxin that usually protects Shell ships. The one installed in the lab must have broken during the fight, judging from the fact you're able to be here now, but this one is fully functional. You bring it back to the ship.

destroyed.text: You've neutralized the Stealth Cruiser, and rescued the Shells in the process.

deadCrew.text: You've neutralized the Stealth Cruiser, and rescued the Shells in the process.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELLHOME_MERCENARY
event.text: You aren't alone at this beacon. Nearby is a Mercenary vessel, all of its systems online but the ship remaining mostly inactive.

choice.text: Hail the Mercenaries and see why they're here.

event.text: "Oh errr. We were hired by some Clansmen to capture one of these Shell ships, but that's a lot harder a task than we were prepared for. Now, we're kinda just waiting here until a Shell ship comes by and randomly dies. However long that'll take..."

choice.text: Help them out, seek out a Shell ship and capture them.

event.text: You fly past the Mercenaries and deeper into the nebula until you encounter a Shell ship.
You decide not to give the pirates any chances and attack immediately.
Mercenaries in Central Shell space can't bode well. You ignore the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELLHOME_IMMUNITY
event.text: You receive a hail from a nearby Shell vessel pursuing what appears to be a Slug Clansman slipping away into the nebula.

"Thhhe Federation helps people, right? We need help! Thhhose Clansmen have stolen samples of thhhe Shell toxins. If thhey can bring it back to thhheir lab, thhhey might be able to develop an antidote! If thhhat happens, thhhhey'll be able to board our ships without any issues."

choice.text: Agree to hunt down the Clansmen.

event.text: "Perfect! If you can recover thhhe samples thhat would be wonderful, but if thhhat is beyond your capabilities don't worry. All we need is thhhem dead."
You don't know what's happening here, but you aren't interested in getting involved. You ignore the Shell, and eventually they give up and continue to chase down the Slugs.

event.name: NEBULA_SHELL_HIDDEN_COLONY
event.text: You catch the rear of a Shell ship slip away into the nebula. If you're quick, you might be able to catch up to them.
As you follow the ship through the nebula, you're shocked to find a massive Shell colony between several connected stations.
You hail the Shells within the colony. They wait for what you will say.
You decide the best course of action here is to attack these peaceful aliens for no good reason.
There is some talk amongst the Shells, but it seems they all agree trading with you will bring no harm.

choice.text: Demand they hand over some supplies.

event.text: You don't know what's happening here, but whatever that lone Shell ship is doing is of no concern to your mission.
The Shells want to avoid a fight at all costs. They hand over what supplies they can spare.
The colony does not take well to your demands. They retaliate with their weapons!

event.name: SHELL_HIDDEN_COLONY_SURRENDER
event.text: "Please, stop! We will give you anythhhing, please just spare thhhe rest of us!"

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_ELITE
event.text: The Shell Radiants are the protectors of Shell space. Their highly toxic composition works well at deterring enemy crew. Unfortunately, it seems one of these ships has found you in the nebula, and thinks you're a threat!

surrender.text: "Ok, ok! I've changed my mind! You can take us alive!"

choice.text: Demand they explain what's going on.

event.text: "We uh... were offered a lot of money by thhhhe Rebels to transfer over some blueprints, cargo, and Morph DNA. Like, a lot of money. Don't look at me like that! Had you been offered the same, you would have done it too!"

"Please don't use thhhe term 'alien.' To us, YOU are thhhe aliens. But... yes, thhhey aren't thhhe kindest folk. But rich as hell! Thhhhey aren't above a basic buyout, easier thhhan raiding an entire sector. Unfortunately... now you're here. And our payment never showed up..."

choice.text: Demand they give you the cargo instead. If the Rebels have use for it, so does the Federation.

event.text: "What?! But what about our money!" You flip a switch to power back on your weapons, and the Shell gulps in anticipation. "Ah... right. Alright fine. I'm so fired for thhhis... Well, I was going to be fired for thhhis anyways. But you get thhhe point. It's like being 'double fired.'"

event.name: MORPH_SITE_DELTA
event.text: It looks like a massive Shell laboratory has been set up here, and it's still functional! However, you can't help but wonder how it survived this long under the Rebel siege.

You receive a response from a frightened Shell scientist. "Crap! You'll never take us alive, Federation!" The station suddenly opens fire without any further reason why. Maybe if you can damage them enough, they'll surrender and you can figure out what's going on.
You have better things to do than bother these Shells.

event.name: MORPH_SITE_DELTA_FAIL
event.text: Looks like you ended up killing the Shells after all. Now nothing remains but some salvage.

event.name: MORPH_SITE_DELTA_UNLOCK
event.text: True to what the Shell said, if the Rebellion has use for this, so will the Federation. For the blueprint, you forward them to the Federation base. The weapon you take with you, and the Morph DNA you lock away for safe keeping. The Rebels don't need to get their hands on this...

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SITE_ALPHA
event.text: Looks like this is... or was, the site of a Shell laboratory. Apparently something important no less, as it's marked "Site Alpha" on your map. Looks like it's been damaged by Rebels though, and a single ship still remains.

choice.text: Attack them to access the lab.

event.text: The Rebel ship is slow to the offense, and says nothing. All the same, they raise their weapons and attack!
This place has already been ransacked. No reason getting involved when we won't get much out of it anyways.

event.name: MORPH_SITE_ALPHA_ENTER
event.text: Another Rebel ship laid to waste by you and your crew. You scrap the hull before you investigate the lab.

You're surprised to find a still functional terminal in one of the rooms. It appears to have been half-way through sending a message until it was disabled by the Rebels. You download the information and play it back on your ship...

"Thhhe final containment unit has been breached. Rebel forces have descended on Site Alpha, and have stolen subject 0. We are requesting immediate backup, an MFK Ace has already arrived. I repeat, we are requesting immediate ba-" The recording cuts short, but you can easily guess how it ended. Nothing pretty, to be certain. Looks like some coordinates are on here too, a tracking beacon on this supposed subject 0.

surrender.text: Suddenly, a voice bursts out of the Rebel ship, though it's oddly unhuman, but you can't place your finger on why. "StOp! THis shIp dosnot want TO fight. Please-stofiring. Please. Please. Please."

event.text: "T-hank yOu. You are... so KInd." It suddenly dawns on you what's off. The voice is spliced together from other audio tracks. It's not even a person speaking, but a bizzare recording.
You don't receive a response for a while, and you begin to think they've ignored you, when suddenly the 'voice' returns. "CaNI trusyou?"
"Thiship- Not REbEls. I am... OO-JMA-JOO. Fatherof MOrpHs. We arescaping. The Shells ARE not-kind. They waNT to-use us forslave labor. WILL you allow usaftety? When I am-safe the Morphs will BE too."

choice.text: Agree to take him with you.

event.text: You expect a Morph to beam aboard, but instead the Rebel ship changes shape, converging into a massive grey blob. "Itappears I AM too large. To fit. I wishforyou TO carRY this segmentof My body. FEEd it so IT may grow. THank YOU, FedERATION."

choice.text: We aren't the right people for this task.

event.text: "I... UNDER stand. Thank youfor not KIlling me." The Rebel ship spits out a weapon, then jumps away.
The ship stops, then immediately jumps away. Guess you scared them off, idiot.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_OOJMAJOO
event.text: Looks like this is the ship carrying the supposed subject zero. Much like the ship before, it makes no attempt to brag, threaten, or insult you like a normal Rebel ship would, but silently moves past.
You can't even be certain if this "subject 0" is still onboard or not, but you aren't going to let these Rebels go without a fight!

Your Morph crew seems to have something to say, but you can't understand them. As you listen to them spouting nonsense, you accidentally bump hulls with the MFK Ace. The ship suddenly turns hostile and attacks!
It's not often you see a Rebel ship like this, but you don't feel like fighting today.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SITE_OMEGA
event.text: You've arrived at Site Omega, the location mentioned by Alkali at the entrance. You spot a large Shell laboratory in the distance, and approach cautiously.
Oddly enough, it appears the gas in the facility has been shut off. It's extremely convenient, but you aren't one to question. You dock with the station and head inside...

The interior hallways are mixed in splashes of red and green blood as you carefully step over the mangled corpses of humans and crumbled bodies of deceased Shells. Looks like a massive firefight happened here, though the uniform on these Rebels stands out... Not one to back down though, you press on, following the trail of carnage.

At last, you reach a locked door, and once you break it open you spot a wounded Shell scientist on the ground, presumably Alkali. As soon as he spots you, he points at a table with a syringe on it. "You. Give me thhhat..."

choice.text: No. You're going to answer some questions first.

event.text: Alkali glares at you, and you aren't even sure if he heard you. "Didn't you hear me? Grab me thhhhat syringe. I don't have time to waste."

choice.text: This is a bad idea. Ignore the station.

event.text: If this place had to go on lockdown, it can't mean anything good.

event.name: ALKALI_LORE
event.text: You quickly administer the brown liquid in the syringe into Alkali's arm. "Good, I just needed something to boost my regenerative properties again. Now, why is thhhe Federation intruding in thhhis sector? I didn't realize thhhe ongoings of thhhe Geniocracy concerned you when you seem much more preoccupied withhh... othhher matters."

choice.text: Could ask the same about why the Rebels are here.

event.text: "Yes, I was wondering thhhe same thhhhing. Thhhey've taken an interest in our... my latest mistakes. Thhhe Morphs, you see, were created to work for thhhe Shells. Do thhhe hard, manual labor. Damn Nerva, thhhe Managment District's director, kept refusing to approve funding for thhhe project! Probably thhhought thhe Morphs were going to make them useless, much like thhhhe Radiants and Military Districts..."

"I wouldn't be surprised if thhhhat bitch sabotaged my facilities! But thhhat's just rumor among thhhe science district... Now, you still have not answered my question. Why are you here? I do not appreciate thhhe unknown staying unknown, and I would like to understand your intentions before you shoot me or sacrifice me to whatever pagan gods you people worship."

choice.text: We're on a quest to reach Node 17.

event.text: "Well no shit, everyone knows WHERE you're going. I swear, everyone is heading to thhhhat forsaken place. A disgrace! You could have used thhhat MV tech to, I don't know, solve ancient mysteries or create some sort of interdimensional utopia. But instead you use it to fight each othhher. We Shells do not suffer from thhhese issues. We are people of science, and have little to worry about internal conflict. Now, you still have not answered me. Have you come to kill me? Recruit me to cure some form of deadly space disease your people suffer from? God damn it, I'm tired of waiting."

choice.text: We heard your distress call and came here.

event.text: "Ah, some kind of philanthropist, are you? Great, well I guess you're a better escort thhhan... I dunno, something thhhat's worse than you. You don't subscribe to any silly religions or conspiracies do you? You are vaccinated, right?"
"Very good thhhen. I request thhhat you transport me back to thhhe Geniocracy when you have a chance. I shall make myself useful in thhhhe meantime. I am no freeloader."

choice.text: (Monk Crew) We are men and women of peace. The Great Eye guides us.

event.text: Alkali looks at you in disgust. "Ugh... well at least I know for certain you aren't going to kill me. For the time I am aboard your ship, you shall let me sleep in whatever room doesn't have any spiritual paraphernalia in it. I don't care if it's a broom closet. I request thhhat you transport me back to thhhe Geniocracy when you have a chance. I shall make myself useful in thhhhe meantime. I am no freeloader."

choice.text: (Faithful Rock Crew) The Elders guide us on the path to glorious life!

event.text: Alkali looks at you in disgust. "Ugh... great, a bunch of barbarians. For the time I am aboard your ship, you shall let me sleep in whatever room doesn't have any spiritual paraphernalia in it. I don't care if it's a broom closet. I request thhhat you transport me back to thhhe Geniocracy when you have a chance. I shall make myself useful in thhhhe meantime. I am no freeloader."

You draw your laser, and shoot Alkali. He dies almost immediately, not having fully recovered from his wounds. There's nothing else to do here now, so you head back to the ship wondering how massive of a mistake this was.

surrender.text: "That is enough! You will hand over the target at once and you will leave this system! This is an order!"

event.text: You send over the Shell scientist to the Rebels, who collect him and carry him away. After this, you're certain they'll alert the fleet of your location. Let's hope that still gives you enough time to leave...

removeCrew.text: Alkali probably won't be alive for long after this one, but you can't clone him when you aren't certain.

event.name: ALKALI_LEGION
event.text: As you begin to depart from the station, a Rebel ship jumps in, but it's not like any Rebel design you remember in your debriefing. Renegades, Elites, MFK Aces, Engineers, none of them bear that logo... A yellow helmet, with the word Legion on it, stands out to you. Is this some new Rebel fleet?

You receive a hail from the Rebel vessel. "Federation. Under any other occasion, I would not hesitate to destroy you. However, we are here on important business. Hand over the scientist, and you will be permitted to leave. Fail to do so, and we will pull him from the hands of your mangled corpses. Attempting to leave this beacon without handing over the target will be met with failure. We have already disabled your long range FTL drive."

"Then you leave us no choice. Do not worry. You won't live long enough to regret this decision." True to their word, it appears your FTL drive has been sabotaged! Your engines will still function, but you won't be able to jump until the Rebels are dead!

Alkali protests, but he isn't going to argue with the barrel of a gun to his forehead. The Rebels board your ship in a concerningly large number, injecting a tranquilizer into Alkali and carting him off. You expect them to turn on you, but nothing happens. Instead, the Rebels head back to their ship and jump away, leaving you dumbfounded.

removeCrew.text: Alkali probably won't be alive for long after this one, but you can't clone him when he hasn't even been entered into your databanks yet.

event.name: ALKALI_LEGION_DEFEATED
event.text: The Rebel vessel has been defeated, leaving behind plenty of scrap matter and an unusually high-tech weapon. Surprisingly, you still detect faint life signs aboard the wreck as you scrap it...

You move closer, tearing open the cargo bay to find a wounded Rebel soldier. As soon as you approach he panics, reaching for a sharp piece of metal, and plunges it deep into his chest. An act of suicide, likely trying to stop you from getting information... but on what?

Seems most of the data on the ship was purged during the fight - a strange practice, but it seems they knew their fate before the fight had even begun. Whatever this ship was, it was under very clear orders not to let anything leak. Maybe this won't be the last time you see a ship like this, though that's very uncertain.

event.name: MORPH_SLUG
event.text: You jump in, expecting to find a ship in distress. Instead, you see a Slug Clansman chewing on some alien popcorn. "Oh, hey watssssup man."
"Oh, yeahhhh that. There wassss sssome Morphsss here a minute ago. Think I ssscared them off tho-" The Slug is cut off when the Morph ship comes flying back, firing on the Slug hull!
There's probably a valid reason for the Morphs attacking these Clansmen... but nonetheless you aren't going to let it happen!

You can imagine why the Morphs are mad - Clansmen aren't known for being friendly to their fellow nebula dwellers... or anyone for that matter. You won't let them become the Guild's next prey. You prepare to defend the Morphs!

choice.text: Alright fun chat, time to leave.
Obviously, they aren't in danger anymore. Leave.

event.text: These Clansmen likely are attempting to lower your guard just to shoot you when you won't expect it. It's better to leave them to be entertained by this sector's unpredictable inhabitants.
It appears the Clansman ship was destroyed in the fight. Little remains but scrap matter for you to take.
It looks as though the Clansman ship took a beating during the fight... but the Slug onboard is still alive. "Ayyy yo my ssship isss totaled. Gonna hang with you now if that'ssss alright."

event.name: MORPH_RUINS
event.text: Though Shells usually stick to the nebulas, it seems a Shell research outpost was set up here previously. It's heavily damaged though, but maybe something is left?

You move closer to the wreck, but are stopped when a mechanic ship flies past. "Hey, is thhhhat really necessary? You're only making our job harder. Management always gets thhhhe worst jobs! I'd rather be scooping out equinoid brains or fighting off Slugs, but yet here I am. Do us a favor and leave thhhhat station alone, would you?"

You ignore the Shells, scooping up all that you can. The ship watches in growing anger, and their captain finally snaps. "Alright, damn you to hell. We have a job to do, and you've officially crossed the line!"

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite helpful! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us better funding? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you know. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

"Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us using thhhose? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you know. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."

choice.text: (Hull Repair Drone) Fix up the station. [-1|]

event.text: "Oh, wow. Thhhhat's quite efficient! Why can't thhhe council authhhhorize us using thhhose? Ugh, I hate thhhis job. You know what? I quit! I'm withhh you know. What are you gonna do about it, huh Director Nerva? Oh man, it feels so good to say thhhat..."
One man's trash is another man's trash too. What could be left worth taking anyways?

event.name: MORPH_PIRATE_INSANE
event.text: Before you can go any further, you're stopped by a pirate vessel. "Have you heard the news!? Our new gods, the Morphs, have risen! The great one himself, oh mighty OOJ MAJOO has been freed from captivity! Do you have an offering for the gods, or will you live a life of regretful sin?!"
"You are wise! I have all certainty the great OOJ MAJOO shall bless you! As a devout believer in the Morphs, I shall grant you passage, and aid in your travels!"
The pirate does extensive work on your hull, and offers an augment to appease you.

"Oh sweet heavens, you're one of them! I am so sorry my lord for not recognizing you!" The pirate falls to his knees, pleading for forgiveness. You promise to spare him so long as he hands over one of the weapons in his storage.
The pirate screeches in rage, and powers up his weapons. You should do the same.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SOLAR
event.text: Normally Shells aren't ones for unmanned tech, and normally you don't see full sized stars deep in the nebula. Despite both of these things being uncommon, it seems you've run into both! A small Shell solar energy collection device is orbiting the star. Inside are several power cells you might be able to interface with... if you can figure the machine out.

choice.text: Take your chance and interface with the device.

event.text: It's too risky, especially this close to a star. You'll have to jump away as soon as you can.
You manage to break open the device, but the power cells are fried. Too damaged to be any worth in your reactor, but you can repurpose them into fuel. Better than nothing.
Somehow you get the process right, and interface directly with the machine. You drain as much power as you can for yourself, which will do good work for your reactor.
You simply can't figure out how the machine works. You fiddle with it for a little longer, but a flare from the star strikes your ship, causing some damage. You give up and hurry to leave.
You play with the machine for a while, and eventually manage to pull out the cells to repurpose as fuel. Unfortunately, a stray science vessel has spotted you... and they aren't happy!
Your Shell knows exactly how this machine works, and they retrieve the power cells to install into your reactor. This will give it a nice boost!

Your Shell knows exactly how this machine works, and they retrieve the power cells to install into your reactor. This will give it a nice boost! Unfortunately, a stray science vessel has spotted you... and they aren't happy!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_PEEPEEPOOPOO
event.text: A hail from the nearest Morph ship bears an odd message. "Pee pee poo poo." To you, this sounds like nothing more than a crude joke. But for all you know, to the Morphs this could be profound.

choice.text: Take some time to decipher it.

event.text: You spend hours analyzing what it could mean. You work your brain, trying every possible angle to look for. At last, you give up. It seems the true meaning of pee pee poo poo shall forever remain lost to you. Fortunately, your efforts don't go entirely in vain, and the morph seems to appreciate your thoughtfulness and gives you a small chunk of scrap.

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Have your Morph explain this meaning to you.

event.text: Your Morph speaks to you for a long time, revealing the universe's inner secrets. The answer to your every problem, the meaning of the universe itself, it is all held tight in this one simple, unassuming phrase. Unfortunately, you don't understand your crewmate's speech either. You suppose these secrets shall remain forever lost to you. Fortunately, this wisdom is not lost on the other ship, who offers a chunk of scrap for being so wise.
You aren't going to let the Morphs insult you like this! You open fire.

choice.text: It's nothing more than crass and crude.

event.text: You do not believe such a phrase could hold any importance. You abandon this thought experiment and carry on.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_ENGINEER_TECHNO
event.text: It appears the nearby Engineer ship isn't attacking you just yet. Instead, they hail. "You know, I should attack you. But frankly, I just want to brag to someone about my latest achievement!"

"You've probably heard of or seen the Technopaths by now. They're like the Morphs, but they can take the form of noncarbon entities instead! Well, I thought it would be a great idea to start replacing my drones with some. It's almost exactly the same amount of efficiency, but without any of the power usage! It's great!"

choice.text: Acknowledge their success and carry on.

event.text: You're only trying to carry on to the next beacon, but the Engineer seems so happy you ackowledged him he even offers you some free droneparts.

choice.text: We aren't here for stories. Attack the engineers!

event.text: You won't show these Rebels mercy jsut because they want to talk!
You mute the Engineers and carry on your way.
You attempt to mute the engineers, but that only agitates them. They attack!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SMUGGLER_CONFUSED
event.text: Nearby is a smuggler, flying through the nebula. Perhaps they have something of value to offer?

You expect a simple response from the vessel, but instead you receive a loud screech, followed by the shout of one of your crew. You run to their location where you see a frightened smuggler holding a pistol to their face. "You- you're one of them morphs, ain't ya! Don't play no damn tricks on me!

choice.text: (Clone Bay) There's no risk here. Blast the asshole and carry on.

event.text: You draw your blaster, shooting the smuggler, but not before he shoots your own crew. Luckily, there indeed is no risk, and your crew comes back perfectly fine. The smuggler ship now inoperable, you scrap some of its hull.

The smuggler screams, horrified at the sight of an actual Morph on your ship. Firing widly, it causes some damage to your ship, but you're able to subdue him. With his ship now inoperable, you scrap some of the hull.
You doubt they have anything to offer thats worth your time.

You talk in a slow, calming voice as you approach the smuggler. This seems to relax him, giving you enough time to grab him and snap his neck. Job well done? With the smuggler out of the way, you loot his pockets and find some resources.

"Hey, you ain't talkin' no gibberish! Tha's good... tha's good... If you ain't no blob though, you outta be careful, them blobs everywhere! It ain't no safe place travelin along, think I oughta come with you folks..."
"You talk real damn good for an impostor!" The smuggler swivels to shoot you, but you manage to jump out of the way. Soon you find yourself in a fight!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_FREEGUN
event.text: Holy crap! A weapon is just floating in space! Sure it's a storm, but a gun is a gun!

choice.text: Our luck is never this good. Leave it.

event.text: God knows what that "gun" could be. You leave it behind and carry on.
Looks like the weapon was real after all!
You draw the weapon onboard, only for it to stir and suddenly split into several separate Technopaths!

You draw the weapon onboard, only for a Morph vessel to come stumbling out of the clouds, yelling. "AKOO BLAT TRI TROO KAPAT RETEROO!" Looks like bringing this weapon onboard has angered them somehow... and it's apparent why. The weapon is in fact another Morph, but they don't seem nearly as hostile as the shouting ship!

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE
event.text: It looks like a Shell vessel is approaching...

event.name: MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE_SCIENCE
event.text: It looks like the Shell ship is a science vessel. They beg you for help. "Thhhhe Rebels, thhhey've been following us everywhere! Would you be so kind as to aid us?"

choice.text: Offer them some supplies to better prepare themselves.

event.text: You give the Shells some missiles and droneparts to help them...
"Oh, you are most generous! You have our best wishes. Here, accept this gift."
Never one to shy away from casual needless murder, you power up the weapons and attack the Shells.
You apologize but have nothing to offer. The Shells nod and carry on.
The Shells are reluctant to trust you to such a degree, and ultimately decline. With nothing else to do, they fly away, leaving you with some time on your hands.
The Shells appreciate the offer and accept. Though most you drop off at a nearby Shell station, one of them wishes to stay behind.
The Shells are reluctant, but ultimately agree. Once dropped off at a nearby station, they offer you some scrap as pay.

event.name: MORPH_SHELL_REFUGEE_IMPOSTER
event.text: It looks like the Shell ship is a science vessel. They beg you for help. "The Rebels, they've been following us everywhere! Would you be so kind as to aid us?"
As soon as they crew step aboard, it's apparent that those Shells... they're Rebels! It was a trap all along!

choice.text: Offer them some supplies to better prepare themselves.

event.text: You give the Shells some missiles and droneparts to help them...
"Oh, you really are stupid after all! It was a trap, idiots!" The ship turns hostile, revealing itself to be piloted by Rebels!
You expect protesting from the Shell vessel, but instead you're met with angry shouts from a Rebel captain! "Damn it, how did you know it was a trap?!"
The Shell ship stays suspiciously silent for a moment, followed by them raising their weapons. A Rebel captain appears on the vidscreen. "Ahahah, it was a trap all along!"

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_BLOCKADE
event.text: When you first jump in, you assume this to be a simple, empty nebula, but such a hope is betrayed when a militant vessel comes out of the clouds. "Hey, didn't you hear Prof. Alkali's warning? Thhhhis sector is dangerous. Thhhhhis beacon is under quarantine. I suggest you move it."

choice.text: You can't tell us what to do!

event.text: You'll be damned if you let anyone tell you where you can and can't go. You arm the weapons and prepare for battle.
You power down the weapons and prepare to leave the system as soon as you can.

event.name: NEBULA_MORPH_AUTOSCIENCECHOICE
event.text: A short range distress signal is being emitted from a Shell science station nearby, which is under attack by a Rebel Auto-ship!
You attack the Auto vessel.
You don't have the time to play hero right now and help the Shells.
"Your timing is most convenient! Thank you, Federation. May this heal your wounds."
It appears the Shells did not make it. All you can do is scrap the hull of the station.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_MORPH_REBEL_JAMMED
event.text: Of all things, you didn't expect to see a Rebel ship being the one to solicit their distress beacon on open comms. Despite being Federation, they don't seem shy to hail you either. "You know that gross sentient space gunk that lives here? Well some of their goopy insides got all stuck in our engines, and now they're jammed. Now I know we don't exactly get along, but there surely could be something in it for you!"

choice.text: Try and fix up their engines.
There couldn't be a better opportunity to attack!

event.text: If they don't have engines, there's nowhere these Rebels can run! Still they try, but it's pointless.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Have your engineer take a look at the engines.

event.text: Fortunately, your engineer clears out the Morphs quickly, and the Rebels seem impressed. "Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Have your Engi take a look at the engines.

event.text: Fortunately, your Engi clears out the Morphs quickly, and the Rebels seem impressed. "Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Have your Morph reawaken the hibernating goo.

event.text: Your Morph lets out a cacophony of shrill chirping, following by many more from the Morphs in the engines, who detach themselves from the mechanism and roll to meet your Morph. The Rebels aren't really sure what they just witnessed, but they reluctantly pay you in "thanks."
Knowing the Rebels, this could just as well be yet another trap. Atleast, they don't seem to follow you.
It's not easy work, but you chip away at the goo with the help of the Rebels. Eventually, you finally scoop out all of the goo, and the Rebels' engines spark to life once again.
It's back-breaking work, and to no avail. The goo simply won't come out, and it becomes clear these engines aren't going to recover...
"Great work! Too bad I'm afraid we're still going to have to alert the fleet on your location!" The Rebel ship speeds off, and you chase after them!
"Hmmm... you've helped us more than we expected. I suppose the act of not murdering us is worthy of some pay as promised."
"Bah, you're worthless. What was I thinking, expecting help from a Fed ship?"

"Though you have proven yourself unable to assist, your willingness to help is most remarkable. As my ship is thoroughly ruined, it would appear my options are either to wait here for some miracle, or to go with you instead. I don't believe in miracles, so I only see one valid option."

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_MORPH_SLICE
event.text: The distress call nearby seems to be coming from a Mantis vessel, whose captain frantically screams at you. "HELP, HELP, HELP HELP HELP HELP! ME TRYING SLICE UP BLOB, BLOB BECOME MORE BLOB! NOW BLOB EVERYWHERE! SO MANY! AAAAAAAAAGH!"

choice.text: Help rid their ship of the Morphs.

event.text: If you're expecting any kind of reward, you'll have to be careful not to destroy the ship!

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Send the drone in to eradicate the morphs. [-1|]
Leave the Mantis to their troubles.

event.text: You do not see any reason to help the Mantis. The Hive has clashed with mightier foes than agitated slimes in the past; they can deal with this on their own.
Your boarding drone makes quick work of the blobs. Once eradicated, the Mantis thanks you and gives you a decent reward.
It appears you didn't plan for the Morphs mimicking your own drone - a Technopath takes the shape of your boarder, and blasts it into pieces! Disparaged, you consider your options.
If you're expecting any kind of reward, you'll have to be careful not to destroy the ship!

choice.text: Ignore the Mantis, there's nothing else to do.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MORPH
textList.text: "KALPU! KALPU! RETER LIP LOO TIKA TIKA BOO!" An irate Morph begins to fling insults you can only imagine are incredibly vulgar in their language. You have literally no idea what you did to anger them though. Maybe just existing is enough to offend them?
As yet another hostile Morph vessel approaches, you can't help but wonder if the Shells never actually finished "designing" their temperament. What else could explain how erratic they are?
You receive a video with a gibberish title which shows several cartoon alien warriors fighting each other in gladiatorial combat. Minutes later, a Morph ship approaches, weapons on the ready.
Something tells you the nearby Morph ship isn't friendly. It might be the aggressive shouting, or their charging weapons. Just a hunch, though.
These aggressive Morphs really set a bad image for the rest of their kind. At least they don't yell "Hey, you're that Federation ship!" every time they see you.
You wonder if the Morphs are even aware who you are, or what your mission is. Unfortunately, "booj kabooj" is not an indicitive answer as a Morph vessel opens fire.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_MORPH
textList.text: The Rebellion's sudden interest in these small, grey, unassuming blobs is concerning. It seems to have drawn a lot of their ships here too, such as the one here currently moving into fight you!
"Hey, you're that Federation ship! Stop right there-" You mute the Rebel vessel. All of these lackeys are the same, they might as well be Morphs themselves.
Something isn't right about this nebula. A sliver of orange slips through the clouds, and your body goes into alert. Rebel vessel inbound!
There's never a dull moment in this sector. This time it appears your foe will be a Rebel. Is it better than a Shell or Morph? Time will tell...

Rebels aren't all too common nowadays outside of sectors of interest or the fleet trailing you, which means if anything the ship here is a sign of something bigger. Beyond that, it's also a sign there's a fight in your very near future!
You gave up your past self to become the brave Multiverse Renegade who'd save the Federation. Now, a Rebel ship moves into your path to stop you. Show them how you get things done.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO_MORPH
textList.text: "Detecting for samples of substance M4-RH. Error. Reprocessing vessel. Federation ship detected. Activating 'sweet jesus that's an enemy' protocol." An Auto-ship quickly transitions from recon to combat mode. Prepare for battle!

You've seen several Rebel vessels prowling about here already, but this time it appears your foe is an automated vessel! Good thing this nebula is keeping you on your toes, because you've already started charging the weapons.
The Atlas entry said the Rebel threat here was high, and these Auto-ships are a clear sign of it. How much property damage will you cause the Rebels today?
"This beacon is under Rebellion control. Federation vessels will not be tolerated." An Auto-vessel moves in. If the Shells haven't taken care of this scrapbucket yet, then you will.
Thankfully, though it's sometimes hard to spot the grey wings of an Auto-ship slipping through the dark nebula, their distinct orange glow gives them away. Get ready for a fight!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SHELL_SCIENTIST_MORPH
event.text: Normally Shell ships are reasonably passive, especially the scientists. However, the ship here doesn't follow that example. "Damn it, we already have to deal with thhhhe Rebels here! We didn't ask for Federation intervention!"
